edu.xtec.jclic.boxes

Class AnimatedActiveBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
      • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
        • java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
          • edu.xtec.jclic.boxes.AbstractBox
            • edu.xtec.jclic.boxes.ActiveBox
              • edu.xtec.jclic.boxes.AnimatedActiveBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, Shape, Serializable, Cloneable, EventListener

    public class AnimatedActiveBox
extends ActiveBox
implements ActionListener
    This class is currently used only in some Skin classes to animate progress bars. It takes a collection of images (stored as elements of an ActiveBagContent) that are used as "frames" of a picture, and displayed one after other. It uses a Timer to generate the events that cause the rotation of frames.
    Version:
    13.08.28
    Author:
    Francesc Busquets (fbusquets@xtec.cat)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
